FuncDef:
The if-match as-path length command configures a matching rule that is based on the AS_Path length.
The undo if-match as-path length command deletes a matching rule that is based on the AS_Path length. The if-match as-path length command configures a matching rule that is based on the AS_Path length. The undo if-match as-path length command deletes a matching rule that is based on the AS_Path length. By default, no matching rules that are based on the AS_Path length are configured.
CLIs: undo if-match as-path length [ <length-value> | greater-equal <greater-equal-value> less-equal <less-equal-value> | { greater-equal <greater-equal-value> | less-equal <less-equal-value> } ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the AS_Path length.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 2047.

Specifies the minimum AS_Path length for matching.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 2046.

Specifies the maximum AS_Path length for matching.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 2047.

ExtraInfo: To configure a matching rule that is based on the AS_Path length, run the if-match as-path length command. After the matching rule is configured, attributes of the routes that match the matching rule can be modified based on the apply clause.
